comments.commentBody:
more of the borrow and spend strategy.
what sort of morals do our leaders have
that they continue to write checks that
our children and their children will have
to make good?
with interest.
all in an attempt to buy a few senior citizens' votes.
that's all i can type.
i have to go outside to throw up.
Lambchop -- What silly nonsense. This is a country, not a house.
If the bill is so beneficial and the reform so effective, then wouldn't people feel the difference without the advertising campaign?

"Why do Dems ignore US laws" - TR

I agree, TR.

Obama needs to bring an army of federal agents to Arizona to fine, arrest, shut down, or otherwise prosecute every business in Arizona that is using illegal immigrant labor. This would include luxury hotels, restaurants, golf courses, landscapers, pool servicers, builders, farmers, individual households. These criminals need to be brought to justice; don't you agree?

Don't you agree this would send the strongest message possible that we will not tolerate illegal activity by our business community citizens while simultaneously clamping-down on the primary reason illegal immigrants are in AZ in the first place?

The President should stay longer than the standard visit and spend some time with the residents of the Gulf region. They are losing their livelihood, much of their environment and for many a way of life. Pledging federal resources is essential but Obama needs to listen to these folks and feel their pain as another President used to say.

What the Republican's have successfully done is changed the conversation from the oil in the gulf and drill baby drill to Obama offering jobs to applicants.

I have to admit that the press follows the GOP and is afraid to not make news out of the latest rants or risk Fox calling them out.
Poll show the vast majority of us want to see health care reform repealed.  The people are speaking...
I will look forward to Senator Reid exercising his leadership on the comprehensive Energy Bill as a prelude to his re-election Senate victory on November 2, 2010.
The boycotts are draining Arizona. I don't mind. Half my family can be rousted under the law.

Jan Brewer, a graduate of Glendale Community College  in Glendale, Arizona. I wonder how much her radiological technologist certification comes into play in drafting and understanding laws and their effect on people.

Reply to lem (37) I know what the law is about. How do you know the law will promote racial profiling? The law has just been enacted. You know nothing about what will happen. You are just making assumptions. Since you stated that you just completed study in Constitutional Law, how can you know the real life practicalities of border enforcement? Theory is one thing. Practical application is another. Governors like Jan Brewer must deal with the real situation and the needs and wants of their constituents. Racial profiling is fine with me. It really comes down to political correctness. If law enforcement officials have reasonable justification to stop someone who may be breaking the law, it should be done.

Reply to Martin 44--- I am more than willing to pay higher taxes for any and all law enforcement to stop illegal immigration into NYS and to deport every single illegal immigrant in NYS. That would be money well spent. I would put the U.S. Navy around the Eastern seaboard. Instead of using our military for the useless war in Iraq, the U.S. Navy could protect the homefront on the East coast. We are talking about an invasion. Therefore, using the military is justified.

Shelia (#15) The points you brought up are all very valid reasons for why illegal immigration is no small point. They come here and take from Americans, actually steal from Americans. They get to bring the entire clan. The laws are insane.

There would not be such outrage about illegal immigration if the problem was extremely small. It is a massive problem. Why should any citizen or legal resident obey any law when illegal immigrants break our immigration laws and enjoy the advantages of this country? Why don't the rest of us break any laws we want and point to illegal immigrants as the justification to ignore any and all laws that we do not like?

Obama can tout the $250.00 rebate all he likes. That does nothing to help seniors trapped in the "donut hole." I read it will take ten years to close the gap in coverage. Of course, that is assuming that nothing in the "universal" health care bill is rescinded. Within ten years, who knows how many seniors will be financially destroyed. Perhaps Obama, still in his late forties, should pay for all his health care needs. The taxpayer could give him and his entire family a grand total of $250.00 for medical expenses. Let him see how far it goes. They can foot the rest of the bill for their health care.

That health care "reform" bill is worthless. It favors the insurance companies. It does little to nothing to make health care affordable for all. I have seen what the Democrats have done and would not do. The Democrats had a real chance to distinguish themselves and failed to do so. The Democratic Party is just as infested with corporate money. Obama is timid. He showed no signs of leadership on health care. He let the health care industry get what they wanted at the expense of the people.

Good thing I have what it being described as the "Cadillac" plan.

I cannot wait to see how watered down the energy bills will be. The oil industry will get everything it wants. The oil companies gave enough money to both parties. Their interests are protected.

Change is not in the air.

Disgusted Independent

In my opinion, this has the potential to bankrupt BP.  The claims from Caribbean nations like the Caymans and Cuba will be huge if the oil hits them, which it may do if the spill continues until they can get the tie-off wells drilled.  And the subsurface effects are really too unknown at this point to predict.  But the ingenuity of plaintiffs lawyers is nearly infinite. The claims from US claimants and the US government (there is government land involved) will also be huge.  And if the oil hits the Gulf Stream and travels to England and Europe, they will be even bigger.
Medicare is careening toward bankruptcy.   The government has created yet another entitlement program for which we have no money.  And the elderly are supposed to get in line for $250.

We are sure that the two events are not near the numbers of times this CRIME has been committed by the administration.  Only two leaked!  So much for 'change'...Today, BHO is feigning 'fury' with Larry King...just another politician, an actor, a liar, a snake-oil salesman!

Jane538#14

What you are describing is not an immigration problem but a policing problem. The fact that the crimes are being committed by immigrants is immaterial. You're not suggesting that a citizen convicted of any of the offenses you describe is tried and if convicted incarcerated and an illegal immigrant is simply taken back across the border. The best way to prevent crime always has been the certainty of detection and conviction. Without the certainty more and more people are prepared to commit crime. If illegal immigrants are coming to Indiana to commit crime it can only be because they think the possibility of detection conviction is low. Rather than simply campaigning against illegal immigrants you should be campaigning against poor quality policing. If they know they gonna get captured they won't come and the locals won't try it either.

kit ramsey, ph.d #26

I would be careful about adding PhD after your name, it carries an unfortunate stigma in these columns. I would ask you, however, during your time as a student, either graduate or college or even school, did you ever take any time off and if you did you ever come back to work refreshed, better able to concentrate? Otherwise, we might just think your PhD fits well with the other.
I can picture New York's Finest pulling people over for putting on a seatbelt after pulling away from a parking space to initiate shakedowns with a law like Arizona's.

"Why do Dems ignore US laws" - TR

Oh, I don't believe all those criminals who hire illegal immigrants in Arizona who own and operate farms, meat processing plants, hotels, landscape companies, golf courses, building contractors, farmers, pool service companies are all Democrats. Do you , TR?

I know you agree that the real way to curb illegal immigration in AZ is to curb law breaking businesses who ignore US law and hire them.

The president may arrive in the Gulf shortly after having giving orders to some General a world away, to kill all the innocents if necessary, to just take that baddest of bad guys out now, even if soldier's lives will be lost. We will not know that of course along with a myriad of other things which go unseen on his schedule everyday and night (when does he really take a vacation?)

Of course, no would want him to arrive with tears flowing down his cheeks after giving those orders, but they surely would after he has seen the plight of poor dead sea turtles floating in the oily marsh. This whole emoting thing is what a woman would not want from a guy walking with her on a dark street to her car, or defending her against a potential gang of home invaders.

Yet, the media has constructed this narrative that a president is not empathetic, thus not doing his job well, unless he is doing an "Oprah" of "Clinton" feeling your pain kind of thing. The press seem to be wanting some paternalistic presidential assurances, seemingly for themselves, even while they are constantly surrounded by the powers of his office which they attempt to trivialize to no end.
Me, I want a guy whose fingers counted to be on that trigger will not waiver if NORAD phones with "Mr President" we have detected a launch from "that" adversary. I want for my family and country a person who gives me comfort that regardless of their political view they will not waiver, not freeze and not tear up. I am from the old school where guys did not just drop tears in front of the people counting on them for leadership during a "how the hell are we going to get out of here situation."

Many of us and that includes many in national media said we wanted him as president over McCain during WallStreet's meltdown because he was "No Drama Obama." . However, now because some good ole boy from La. and our esteemed Ms. Maureen D. has screamed that he is not feeling us...He is suddenly a failure at not stopping and repairing an oil drilling problem that government has no capability of accomplishing at any speed.

American is caught in this media vortex where I am afraid to acknowledge (as much as I cherish reading and listening to them) they seem to write to impress each other. There is particular problem with that observation even though we all can and do benefit from some of their areas of expertise, but when they focus on trivia which they often do, it influences public opinion where many people are susceptible to the "drift", or conventional wisdom. Therefore since politicians know who controls the drift they too must adjust their governance to fit a narrative instead of just doing the job.

For example, it is said the President Obama may become captive to this Oil Spill which will be evident if he doesn't go on the planned trip to Australia. However, if he does go, what will be the entity that blows his leaving during (the next two year crises) on a presidential mission totally out of proportion if he takes the trip? You guessed it the media.

Please Mr. and Mrs. Journalists and Pundit and Punditress...Inform and educate, but for heaven's sake please stop manipulating we poor lemmings just to get in front of that red eye, or be invited to take a chair during the Sunday morning roundtable (s).

Do it for your family there is remember there is something still called American posterity.

Tony.... Suborn fits perfectly.   To secretely induce someone to commit an illegal act.  What's not to love about that?  Parse the law, spin it, dismiss it as politics as usual, blame the Rebublicans, blame the blue dogs, excuse it as an ordinary event in politics... it doesn't matter what you think.  It is the law of the land, etched in stone as it were.  You may even think it' s a bad law.  Still doesn't matter.  It's on the books for all to see and abide by.  Unless, I guess, you live in the WH and are a constitutional scholar.  Come to think of it, I know of a stop sign that shouldn't be there.  Guess I'll just run it tomorrow and plead that it's an inconsequential sign and every body runs it.  That makes the wreck a moot point doesn't it?
Wal-Mart, Tyson and the trucking industry are all known to subject their workers to terrible working conditions too.They are more of an embarrassment than anything.

Third world country? Do you realize how silly that sounds? Arkansas probably has a higher per capita income than Canada and much more functional state government than California.

We do not want that foolishness here. Give me a Clinton over a Reagan or a Terminator any day. You folks have really elected some doozies over the years.

The idea in competitive sports, especially professional sports, is to win. Professionals get paid based on their individual performance as well as their contribution to the team's performance. I am sure that notoriety aside, Gallaraga would certainly get a lot of money had the 27th batter been called out. Furthermore, if this had been a 1 run game and the next Indian slugged a home run. The Tigers could have lost. That loss would possibly cost them the pennant.

All that aside, no fan wants a bad call ruining their enjoyment and his team.s success. While the game has evolved, technology has evolved much faster. It's time that MLB take advantage of that fact. Purists may object but where were they when the designated hitter was introduced?
